programme.title: Hotel Hell

programme.desc: Team Salvage attempts to recover two 16-ton sections of a bridge washed away in heavy flooding.

programme.desc: Team Salvage heads to the Northern Territory for a time-critical beach recovery.

programme.desc: Gordon needs to pick 12 men to form a dependable team for his business.

programme.desc: The prison's routines and systems start getting to Gordon, and he struggles to keep his team in line.

programme.desc: Gordon invites players from the coffee shop industry are to the prison to try some of the food.

programme.title: Gordon Behind Bars
programme.desc: Gordon must find a business willing to buy his prison-made products in order to keep the business alive.

programme.title: Gordon's Great Escape
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay starts his culinary journey in the north of India where he cooks for 400 passengers in an express train's cramped pantry car.

programme.title: Gordon's Great Escape
programme.desc: Gordon immerses himself in the life of a local tribe in Nagaland, visits Assam to enter a housewives' competition and sets up shop on the streets of Calcutta.

programme.desc: Gordon ends his travels to India by heading south, living in an ashram in Kerala and working alongside one of India's top chefs in Mumbai.

programme.title: Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Ramsay tries to help the inexperienced owners of The Cambridge Hotel turn their business around.

programme.title: Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Ramsay visits Milford, Pa., to check out the River Rock Inn, which is in desperate need of cleaning and repairs.

programme.title: Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Ramsay travels to the Juniper Hill Inn in Windsor, Vt., a place that's beauty is undermined by the smell of raw sewage and the owner's poor treatment of the staff.

programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay sets out to investigate the controversial "shark fin soup."

programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay travels to the seaside to help ailing hotel and restaurant, The Sandgate.
